title: Misleading deprecation notice for filtering on `:example_group` metadata
body:
I was seeing deprecation warnings the indicated my top-level describe block was guilty of accessing the `:example_group` metadata key, but had a very hard time tracking down the true culprit because it looks like it was in the metadata filtering.

I added `config.raise_errors_for_deprecations!` to my `spec_helper.rb` to get this backtrace.

I believe the true root of the problem was in a 3rd party gem, https://github.com/elabs/pundit/ at
https://github.com/elabs/pundit/blob/998971798cb432fbaa9f4d7ebf2f0b917e6b2fcc/lib/pundit/rspec.rb#L49 However since the filtering happens within RSpec, it's really unclear where this is coming from.

We should be able to recognize when metadata filtering is set up based on the `:example_group` as soon as it happens and warn against it, therefor identifying the true culprit for these deprecation messages.
